newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil Fipe inflation 0.32 pct in April 23-May 23.
newsitem.headline: Brazil Fipe inflation 0.32 pct in April 23-May 23.

text.p: Brazil's inflation as measured by the Economic Research Institute (Fipe) edged up to 0.32 percent in the April 23-May 23 period versus 0.30 percent in the prior four-week period, a Fipe official said.
Fipe chief Juarez Rizzieri said the rise in the index, which measures inflation in the Sao Paulo area, was due mostly to rises in telephone and electricity rates.
"The telephone tariff went up 23.76 percent and electricity rose 4.89 percent," he said.
Clothing prices also rose with the approach of winter in the southern hemisphere but at a slower pace then in recent weeks, Rizzieri said.
He forecast May inflation would reach between 0.3 and 0.4 percent.
While clothing, housing and health care costs rose in the four-week period, food, transportation and personal expenses declined, he added.
Rizzieri released the following breakdown of Fipe's weighted inflation index for April 23 through May 23:
- Food: -1.69 pct drop in the month
- Housing: 1.49 pct rise in the month
- Transportation: -0.05 pct drop in the month
- Personal expenses: -0.50 pct drop in the month
- Clothing: 5.59 pct rise in the month
- Health care: 1.11 pct rise in the month
- Education: 0.04 pct rise in the month
The Fipe index is calculated by the University of Sao Paulo, which releases inflation figures weekly.
